content:
Web search results:

[1] "Please continue. and various others. Please finish the sentence, however, feels a bit peremptory. Its an imperative that instructs the person to finish what they are saying and then stop to listen. Again, depending on the power dynamic, this may be appropriate if the person interrupting has something important to say. For example:"
Source: https://ell.stackexchange.com/questions/208652/please-continue-or-please-complete-your-sentence

[2] "1 : to maintain without interruption a condition, course, or action The boat continued downstream. 2 : to remain in existence : endure The tradition continues to this day. 3 : to remain in a place or condition : stay We cannot continue here much longer. 4 : to resume an activity after interruption Well continue after lunch. transitive verb 1 a"
Source: https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/continue

[3] "please continue is the most popular phrase on the web. More popular! please continue 12,800,000 results on the web Some examples from the web: Im sorry, please continue. But if it makes you happy please continue with your story Please continue to point out the obvious to me as it comes up."
Source: https://textranch.com/221403/please-proceed/or/please-continue/
Current date: 1/26/2023
Instructions: Using the provided web search results, write a comprehensive reply to the given prompt. Make sure to cite results using [[number](URL)] notation after the reference. If the provided search results refer to multiple subjects with the same name, write separate answers for each subject.
Prompt: please continue
